intro: Stegolepis maguireana, commonly known as the Maguire's stegolepis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
